results.title: Stars and galaxies (MAC & PC)
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: World renowned star photographer David Maitland of the Anglo-Australian Observatory, along with others reveal the universe in brilliant colour. The evolution of a star in a gaseous nebulae through to the final stages of its life as a white dwarf, supernova, pulsar or black hole. Additional sequences trace the history of astronomy and the development of optical and radio telescopes. This CD provides excellent information for teaching about Astronomy in the classroom.

results.title: Starlife (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra-terrestrial imagery of great beauty.

results.title: Stanley: Every Home Should Have One
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Andrew Gaty and Seven Keys
results.brief_description: Stanley Dunstan is a young eccentric. The son and heir to a family fortune has eluded all attempts by his father to make him “normal”, and escapes from attempts to incarcerate him in the family sanatorium. Stanley retreats to prove he can become “normal” on his own, and does so by tracking down Australia’s most “normal” family with whom he moves in and on whom he models his behaviour. Stars Graham Kennedy, Nell Campbell, Peter Bensley and Michael Craig.

results.title: Stanislavsky: maker of the modern theater
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell, Films for the Humanities and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Explores the life, times and ideas of the theatrical innovator, Constantine Stanislavsky, who created method acting and founded the Moscow Art Theatre. Uses documentary footage, photographs, and dramatisations to show his memorable roles, his search for reality in character portrayal, and his staging of plays of Chekhov, Ostrovsky, Ibsen, Maeterlinch, Gorki and Turgeniev. Narrated by Paul Rogers.

results.title: Stani the tortoise
results.brief_description: A small boy is invariably late for school because he stops to watch things that interest him on the way. the problem is solved by impressing on him that school is merely another way of learning about interesting things - and by arranging for two schoolmates to meet him every morning and walk to school with him.

results.title: Standing waves and the principle of superposition
results.creator_credit: Ron Sorri and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates what happens when waves meet and how a standing wave is formed by the superposition of identical travelling waves in opposite directions.

results.title: Stalin: man and image
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: A documentary examining the image Stalin created by exploring the man, his rise to power and his place in history. Historical perspective is provided by use of classic film footage showing the 1917 Russian Revolution, Lenin, Trotsky and Stalin. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.
